description:
Detects the presence of unicode characters which are homoglyphs, or identical in appearance, to ASCII letter characters.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques. Only "perfect" homoglyphs are included; these are characters that
are indistinguishable from ASCII characters and thus may make excellent candidates for homoglyph attack characters.
author: Micah Babinski
@micahbabinski
false_positives: File names with legitimate Cyrillic text. Will likely require tuning (or not be usable) in countries where these alphabets are in use.
name: Potential Homoglyph Attack Using Lookalike Characters in Filename
query: ((file.path.text:("*А*" OR "*В*" OR "*Е*" OR "*К*" OR "*М*" OR "*Н*" OR "*О*" OR "*Р*" OR "*С*" OR "*Т*" OR "*Х*" OR "*Ѕ*" OR "*І*" OR "*Ј*" OR "*Ү*" OR "*Ӏ*" OR "*Ԍ*" OR "*Ԛ*" OR "*Ԝ*" OR "*Α*" OR "*Β*" OR "*Ε*" OR "*Ζ*" OR "*Η*" OR "*Ι*" OR "*Κ*" OR "*Μ*" OR "*Ν*" OR "*Ο*" OR "*Ρ*" OR "*Τ*" OR "*Υ*" OR "*Χ*")) OR (file.path.text:("*а*" OR "*е*" OR "*о*" OR "*р*" OR "*с*" OR "*х*" OR "*ѕ*" OR "*і*" OR "*ӏ*" OR "*ј*" OR "*һ*" OR "*ԁ*" OR "*ԛ*" OR "*ԝ*" OR "*ο*")))
